Are you preparing for the CTET December 2024 exam? This video dives deep into the Hindi Pedagogy section, focusing on key educational theories by Noam Chomsky, Jean Piaget, and Lev Vygotsky. Understanding these theories is crucial for acing your CTET exam, especially in the context of child development and language acquisition.

In this video, we cover:

Noam Chomsky's theory of Universal Grammar
Jean Piaget's Cognitive Development Theory
Lev Vygotsky's Social Development Theory
Learn how these educational psychologists' theories relate to teaching in the Hindi language classroom, and how to apply them for effective pedagogy.

Make sure to watch till the end for exam tips, example questions, and how these theories are tested in CTET exams.

Subscribe to the channel for more CTET prep content, and hit the notification bell to never miss an update.
